title: Walmart’s Small-Space Sofa from Drew Barrymore Looks 3x the Price
author: Morgan Pryor
text: DecoratingFurnitureShoppingMorgan PryorCommerce Assistant EditorMorgan PryorCommerce Assistant EditorI cover must-have home products, sales, and brand launches. Prior to working at ATM, I earned my degree in Culture Writing and Criticism from NYU, and I interned at publications like CNN Underscored, TV Insider, Texas Monthly (I'm a Dallas native), and more. When I'm not writing, I'm usually at the movies or browsing in a thrift store.published yesterdayWe independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.Looking for more small-space solutions? Check out our Big Shopping Guide for Small-Space Living, which is packed with our favorite furniture, decor, hacks, and organizing and storage finds for maximizing every inch of every area of your home.When you’re furnishing a small space — whether it’s a room or a studio apartment — it can become frustrating quickly. You can take it from me, as someone who has lived in multiple shoebox apartments in New York City over the years. By far, the most difficult part is trying to make a sofa work when your bed, dresser, and other clunky pieces of furniture are just steps away. Plus, it’s not easy to find a couch that’s small-space-friendly and comfortable, stylish, and budget-friendly. When I started my search, most I came across were either well over $1,000 or little more than bare-bones futons.That’s why I wish I had known that this gorgeous sofa from Drew Barrymore was available at Walmart. It checks all of the boxes I had when I was outfitting my studio: It’s neutral enough to work with any design style and boasts a compact footprint, but shoppers say it’s still “super comfortable.” It’s hard to believe that its price is under $400 — but it really isn’t too good to be true!What Is the Beautiful Drew Sofa by Drew Barrymore?Like the other pieces in Barrymore’s Beautiful line, this sofa has so much going for it — and it comes in at an extremely affordable price point. It’s upholstered in stain-treated (and trendy) bouclé fabric, a feature shared by her mega-popular swivel chair. The material, which comes in white or grey, is as durable as it is stylish, and you can also reverse the back cushion whenever the need arises.The seat cushions are springy and padded for longterm lounging; you can also lean against the rounded armrests (which also give it even more visual appeal). The best part? The sofa only measures a little over 72 inches wide and 31.5 inches deep, so you can nap, watch TV, and relax on it, all without it taking up too much space in your home.What Walmart Shoppers Are Saying “We love our new couch, it’s super comfortable and cozy while the design is chic/modern. I think it’s a great nap couch and my over-6-foot boyfriend and I are both able to fit on it much more comfortably than our old couch. It’s also perfect for small spaces at the same time!” —cleocat “This cute little couch comes in a compact, easy-to-maneuver box; Two slides and 12 screws later and you are done! It does sit very low and would actually be amazing in a kids’ room or playroom. I purchased the dark grey for my office. The size and height help to not overwhelm the room and make the couch feel awkward in the space. Love everything about it. I have also purchased the matching ottoman and swivel chair. I’m obsessed!” —Christina “Beautiful couch! Absolutely love it for my small space. Only con is that it’s low to the ground, but I don’t mind it at all. The material is soft and the cushions have a spring mattress feel. Still comfy to cozy up in. Took less than hour to unpack and set up by myself.” —Nora What’s more, another version of the Drew sofa just launched! For a little extra cash, you can grab it in striped linen, which offers all of the same features (aside from the fabric) and has a beachier feel. Regardless of which one you choose, it’s bound to make your small space so much cozier!Buy: Beautiful Drew Sofa by Drew Barrymore, $364
html:

  • Furniture

Morgan PryorCommerce Assistant Editor

Morgan PryorCommerce Assistant Editor

I cover must-have home products, sales, and brand launches. Prior to working at ATM, I earned my degree in Culture Writing and Criticism from NYU, and I interned at publications like CNN Underscored, TV Insider, Texas Monthly (I'm a Dallas native), and more. When I'm not writing, I'm usually at the movies or browsing in a thrift store.

published yesterday

We independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

Looking for more small-space solutions? Check out our Big Shopping Guide for Small-Space Living, which is packed with our favorite furniture, decor, hacks, and organizing and storage finds for maximizing every inch of every area of your home.

When you’re furnishing a small space — whether it’s a room or a studio apartment — it can become frustrating quickly. You can take it from me, as someone who has lived in multiple shoebox apartments in New York City over the years. By far, the most difficult part is trying to make a sofa work when your bed, dresser, and other clunky pieces of furniture are just steps away. Plus, it’s not easy to find a couch that’s small-space-friendly and comfortable, stylish, and budget-friendly. When I started my search, most I came across were either well over $1,000 or little more than bare-bones futons.

That’s why I wish I had known that this gorgeous sofa from Drew Barrymore was available at Walmart. It checks all of the boxes I had when I was outfitting my studio: It’s neutral enough to work with any design style and boasts a compact footprint, but shoppers say it’s still “super comfortable.” It’s hard to believe that its price is under $400 — but it really isn’t too good to be true!

What Is the Beautiful Drew Sofa by Drew Barrymore?

Like the other pieces in Barrymore’s Beautiful line, this sofa has so much going for it — and it comes in at an extremely affordable price point. It’s upholstered in stain-treated (and trendy) bouclé fabric, a feature shared by her mega-popular swivel chair. The material, which comes in white or grey, is as durable as it is stylish, and you can also reverse the back cushion whenever the need arises.

The seat cushions are springy and padded for longterm lounging; you can also lean against the rounded armrests (which also give it even more visual appeal). The best part? The sofa only measures a little over 72 inches wide and 31.5 inches deep, so you can nap, watch TV, and relax on it, all without it taking up too much space in your home.

What Walmart Shoppers Are Saying

“We love our new couch, it’s super comfortable and cozy while the design is chic/modern. I think it’s a great nap couch and my over-6-foot boyfriend and I are both able to fit on it much more comfortably than our old couch. It’s also perfect for small spaces at the same time!” —cleocat

“This cute little couch comes in a compact, easy-to-maneuver box; Two slides and 12 screws later and you are done! It does sit very low and would actually be amazing in a kids’ room or playroom. I purchased the dark grey for my office. The size and height help to not overwhelm the room and make the couch feel awkward in the space. Love everything about it. I have also purchased the matching ottoman and swivel chair. I’m obsessed!” —Christina

“Beautiful couch! Absolutely love it for my small space. Only con is that it’s low to the ground, but I don’t mind it at all. The material is soft and the cushions have a spring mattress feel. Still comfy to cozy up in. Took less than hour to unpack and set up by myself.” —Nora

What’s more, another version of the Drew sofa just launched! For a little extra cash, you can grab it in striped linen, which offers all of the same features (aside from the fabric) and has a beachier feel. Regardless of which one you choose, it’s bound to make your small space so much cozier!

Buy: Beautiful Drew Sofa by Drew Barrymore, $364
